narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This is a great class, overall, and I wish it could have been a full semester course, to really practice everything we're learning more than once.
1-credit courses are obviously extremely limited in the content they can cover, but Prof. Vance did a good job of moving through a lot of material quickly.

Wiliam is a great teacher and goes through the material very clearly and patiently (when students ask questions). I really appreciated having such a good communicator as inspiration for reaching the goal with this class.

A very helpful course. It seemed like the need to cancel classes due to snowfall condensed the meetings a bit - I think having them presented as they were originally intended to be would have made a good course even better (but obviously that's out of the instructors' control).
It would be sort of silly if the instructor of an communications course was unable to communicate clearly, no?

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Different technics and skills that are applicable for the public speaking
The public speaking practice was very helpful, especially the feedback. Several of the tips & tricks given throughout the course were quite useful.
I liked working in small groups and giving each other feedback.
Being forced to watch myself on video was very helpful.
Content, Pace and the coaches
The weekly practice in our group.

Very broad overview of different topics in short time. Thus, the course was very intensive but very helpful to learn tools of effective communication. I think a class like this should actually be mandatory for everyone! Maybe this can be integrated into the syllabus this way. I especially liked the presentation skills and the exercises we did in the group - I also learned a lot about the different type of roles within a group/team (very helpful) and enjoyed to work with others on theses topics and exchange our experiences & learnings. I appreciated the structure of the class, in particular that we had a coach who was attributed to each group and guided the exercises. I also appreciated the video format so we could experience us on video and be more aware of how we communicate. Great class!!

The course is very practical and constantly based on communications practice. It is a must for every student, regardless of their interests and area of expertise. It teaches valuable skills for public speaking and clear communication.
I really enjoyed the break out sessions
The feedback from the communication specialists and peers was very valuable. Also being able to watch my presentations on video afterwards was great in terms of defining what I need to do to improve.

Although it was a bit tough to follow a practice session, I felt that I was challenged and learned more about communicating skills. Also it was useful to have various possible occasions in the practice time.
Practicing speaking in real time, and getting more of a framework for how to participate in meeting and lead panels.
Presentations, speeches, pannels
The skills you learn are modeled back to you by the instructors. Breaking into the small groups is very helpful. The course is well-organized.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The course was well designed in spite of the cancellation of a couple of classes.

- Any activity that involved playing pretend was essentially useless. It does me no good to "practice" participating in a debate or meeting if I'm also pretending to be someone whose views are entirely opposed to mine. Our time would have been better spent with more speaking - There's no good way of adopting feedback. We do an activity, get feedback, and then never do the activity again. It would be better to have the public speaking run 1/2 as long (a 2 min preso instead of 5), but run through it twice. The 1 time I saw a student do that, the impact was huge. - It would be REALLY helpful to have a session spent reviewing our actual coverletters. At the very least, we should be required to write one prior to the class so that we have something to improve. That is a very relevant skill. - Evaluations should be submitted (even just on paper) immediately after the course, not 2 months later
Offer a full semester version of this course, and/or directly integrate the material into other courses.
Nothing.. Everything was perfect
None

Unfortunately, because of weather conditions we had to move some classes to same day. I do think that for this class it is actually better to have several classes over a longer timeframe instead of long classes once or twice because the material needs to sink in and it helps to repeat it over time so that the lessons & messages are really saved on the "hard-drive" of our brains. Thus, if something similar would happen next year I would rather extend the class instead of reduce the length in weeks.
More sessions for practice.

I would have preferred to take this course my first semester so that I could use the skills learned right away. Also, the instructor seems a bit formal and "old school", networking and communication these days does not always take this approach.

I would rather the course build on the skills taught at the beginning rather than adding new modules. For instance, there are other resources available to students interested in learning to negotiate. That time would be better spent doing additional presentation, panel, or group work practice. The negotiation module, in particular, required a certain degree of inventiveness and improv that was difficult for some students. Perhaps instead, the course could culminate in a final class in which each student makes a very short power point presentation and then participates in a mock panel interview. (just one idea)

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: It was well prepared !
I enjoyed the course lectures and discussion section--they blended together seamlessly.
We broke up into smaller groups during class to practice what we learned. I thought that was very helpful.
What was taught was immediately practiced. It was a great way to absorb what we learnt in theory.
Very effective

Good relationship! Lecture was short and informative and lab section gave us enough time to experiment with learnings from lecture. I liked the amount of time attributed to the sections we had enough time to discuss and exchange learnings. I have following suggestion for class exercise: more role play in the sense of real-life examples for us: group of 5 where 4 for example play SOM students (or law students, engineers at a company,...) who are not at all interested in environmental issues. 1 person needs to convince them that it is important. and then switch around (other are 4 people in that role and 1 person tries to convince them). Also, this is a good example for women leadership and communication within men-led culture - 4 play men with traditional view (not taking women very seriously) and 1 play women. Or age difference 4 play 50-60 year old and 1 play 26 year old who want to convince them of new idea/mindset/... then discuss: What are the learnings - what are the tools that help convince people. How can you promote your voice and message?
They were very related; the class was well-designed
It was effective still; and I was a bit confused about what I was really supposed to do In practice time.
Very effective. Wish that we didn't have those snow days!

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Help me a lot regarding my professional environmental communication skills.
Everyone, in every discipline, needs to take the course--it is the most useful preparation for professional communications.
Persuasive communication is important in any job or career.
Communication is an integral part of the whole course. It assists in sharing our views and ideas effectively.
Communication skill is critical for any field.

Good communication is one of the most important things to learn - especially for environmental managers where we need to be able to convince others and share our message/mindset. Given that I want to go into business this is crucial for me. Knowing how to frame the issue so that others are interested in what we do is very important. The course gave me a really good first taste of this. I hope I have further opportunities to refine this.
Important for every student to be able to clearly and eloquently deliver their ideas and this course teached the mechanisms to do this efficiently.
Very helpful as professional skill developer
I think this course should be a requirement for all students in the forestry school's masters' programs, environmental communication is a valuable skill for work-life.

In general, it's a critical component to improve and keep practicing I learn. I know some people can do this well by instinct or personality, but some people like me are needed to be practiced and helped.

This class was very helpful to my program and career goals. I took this class primarily for the presentation help... and it has given me much confidence and the tools necessary to improvemy speaking skills.
Clear communication is key to success in any profession.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Wanted to review public speaking skills before graduating, and it was effective for me. I was able to integrate what I learned in the global communication class and I've learned from all the FES course works In this class, I had difficulties in controlling my nervous feeling during my presentation and public speaking. This was because I was surrounded by the native English speakers and I felt I was really vulnerable in terms of what I speak and how I speak. It was really good experience for me to try to convey my messages under such an 'uncomfortable' conditions. Thanks for the great class!
To practice & hone my public speaking & presentation skills
To improve my public speaking skills
Mostly I was interested in the verbal communication aspects of the class.
I wanted to get better at public speaking.

To improve my communication skill.
Great Teacher and good exercises. Good communication crucial for my career pathway.

Presentation help!
